thread.title: Hagen Days: Super sophomore led Salem football in ‘70
thread.title_full: Hagen Days: Super sophomore led Salem football in ‘70

author: Football Memories Michael Muldoon
title: Hagen Days: Super sophomore led Salem football in ‘70
text:
45 years ago 
Underclassmen lead Devils 
Salem blitzed Milford 41-13 with all underclassmen doing the scoring: sophomore Pete Hagen 4 TDs, sophomore Eric Phelps 2 TDs, junior Bob Murphy 2 TDs. ... Ex-Andover star Paul Whitley had a juggernaut at Billerica, which pounded North Reading 44-0. ... Archbishop Williams doubled up on Central Catholic 28-14. For Central, Gene Massa scored on a 6-yard run and Mike Menery fired a 22-yard TD strike to Mike Qualter. ... 
Bobby Bedrosian of Methuen scored twice, one a 25-yard pass from Nordo Nissi, and Brooks dumped Roxbury Latin 28-14. ... Stocky QB Steve Tisbert was a player to watch for Andover. The bad news was the 5-6, 185-pounder was the Golden Warriors’ heaviest offensive starter! ... Phillips, featuring post-grad Bill Belichick from Maryland and his friend Ernie Adams, beat the Tufts JVs 26-12. “Pineapple Milt” Holt of Hawaii threw for 133 yards and a score. 
Pentucket set the school scoring record in a 55-6 shellacking of Georgetown. “There wasn’t anything I could do,” said an apologetic Sachems coach Tom Flaherty. Vic Sanchez scored three times and Dan Gulezian twice. For Georgetown, Kevin Smith threw a 6-yard TD pass to Paul Holbrook. ... 
Greater Lawrence topped Worcester Trade 26-6 behind two touchdowns and two interceptions from Mickey Feugill. Don Deschene (125 rushing yards) and Dave Connors also scored. The Reggies that year varied in size from massive 6-2, 240-pound Steve Woodard to tiny 5-2, 105-pound Chuck Barr. ... Chelmsford blanked Tenney, 13-0. Linebacker John Buco and end Dave McEvoy shined defensively in the loss. 
35 years ago 
Speller, Lancers make history 
Lawrence, under first-year coach Steve Perocchi, downed Haverhill, 21-7, to improve to 3-0, its best start in 10 years. Dave Speller scored on a 64-yard run and a 33-yard interception. Haverhill’s Bill Riley made a gorgeous 19-yard TD catch on a throw from QB Dan Ruth. ... Five turnovers were too much to overcome as North Andover was whitewashed by Newburyport 17-0. ... Ron Doucette reached paydirt on a 4-yard run but Triton bested North Reading 14-7. ... 
In a matchup of 3-0 teams, Salem shaded Trinity 7-6. Pioneers coach Jack Gati elected to go for a 2-point conversion with 50 seconds to play but his club was denied. John Palmieri scored on a 1-yard run in the third for the Devils and added the PAT. ... Jim Page threw three TD passes and Peter Durkee scored twice for Georgetown in a 34-7 win over Whittier. Gary Chapman’s 1-yard run accounted for the Whittier scoring. ... 
Anthony Nutter scored on an 84-yard kickoff return but Middlesex beat Brooks 29-22. ... Winnacunnet held off Timberlane 14-12. With kicker Scott Mezquita out, Owls coach Mike Cassano unsuccessfully went for the touchdown in the final minute instead of a 25-yard field goal try. Shawn Menzie threw for 185 yards in the loss with Chuck Blinn hauling in eight passes for 147 yards and a score. ... Wilmington blanked Central Catholic 21-0. Paul Tassinari blocked a punt in the loss. ... 
Andover defeated Greater Lawrence 19-8 as junior Brien Moriarty had a monster day, completing 16 of 25 passes for 277 yards including TD passes to Wayne Merola, Bob Heidt and Glenn McIntyre. Shawn Owen and Pierre Jones starred for the Reggies. ... On 4th and goal from inside the 1-foot line, Choate scored with 15 seconds to play to beat Phillips 16-12. Jim Lacourse, a post-grad from Andover High, caught an 11-yard TD pass for the Big Blue. ... 
Larry Klimas was a happy man as he guided Methuen over his old team, Austin Prep, 21-0. Jim Graham came off the injured list to rush for 70 yards and score all three TDs. ... Pinkerton hadn’t beaten BG in nine years but that changed with a 22-16 win. Dave Garcia (92-yarder) and Jim Davis (91-yarder) both scored on long runs. 
Did you know? 
Haverhill made national news in September of 1965 when coach Paul Ryan outlawed “Beatles haircuts.” Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
